content: Savings Bank Account Asked by AnonymousAsked on 31 Aug 2018Which high interest bearing savings account do you use and why?DBS Multiplier vs OCBC 360 vs UOB One8 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (8)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 02 Sep 2018DBSM because easily with 2 transaction type may hit 1.9% and with another transaction such as investment may hit 2.2%.  Furthermore, DBS is quite innovative these days on their IBanking apps, offerings. If any investment via DBS Vickers would much easier and convenient than the rest. 0 comments2

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered 3w agoI use DBS Multiplier, mostly because it allows for multi-currency, so I can keep my USD dollars in this account too.Very useful!0 comments0
Charlot NgLevel 2. RookieAnswered 3w agoUOB one with 3 GIRO charged and CC $500 spent. Will start to use Salary crediting for OCBC 360 account once my UOB one reaches the limit.0 comments0

Mike Ferrer, Head Of Community Management at TenXLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered 3w agoDBS Multiplier because it's already my main bank, giving a consolidated overview of my finances and so easier to achieve the eligible transactions to hit the higher interest rates.0 comments0

Aik KaiLevel 6. MasterAnswered 3w agoI personally prefer DBS as it is rather easy to hit the high tier interest based on my spending habit. Plus a lot of things can be done online which makes banking very convenient.I find OCBC a bit troublesome with slightly more hassle. Never really try UOB one though. Not planning to as I feel that reconciliation will be a headache.0 comments0

Ck ChaiLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 03 Sep 2018DBS Multiplier, I like the fact that there is no minimum spending requirement for the credit card and can easily hit 1.85% interest just by fulfilling only 2 criteria.0 comments0

Isabella JoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 03 Sep 2018DBS Multiplier since I can combo with another promotion DBS BYOB (promo ended last year). I like that there's no minimum spend with credit card, hence it's easier to achieve 2 transaction type. 0 comments0

Charmaine Ng, The Code Breaker at @ Every Chye Peng StallLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 02 Sep 2018Skip OCBC. Their IT and Stand chart has been pretty worrying these days.​If only within these 3 then yes DBSM as UOB One is good at 3.88% now but there are criterias like minimum $500 spending per mth, salary crediting etc. If it's not an hassle for you and easily achievable then go for it.​For OCBC 360 personally I think it's a little tedious and hassle to hit all the different criterias.​0 comments0
